issues.body:
Nice feature, I like the idea.
Thanks for the code and improvements.

Thank you for the fix! 
I've totally missed that when writing the README.

However, I understand your point for the JS examples but I've kept the syntax the way it was to be coherent with the rest of the code.
Done :)
Thanks!

Hi,
Thanks for the pull request, I like the idea.

If you have the time, could you modify it to use a route like:
/:resource?from=&to=

This way it could be used in conjunction with filters:
/:resource?attr=&from=&to=

Ideally, it should goes in `list` function.

Cool, thanks for considering. Changing will be easy, will do and update the
pull request

Related question: seems there is duplicate code between read and read-write
routes, do you plan to consolidate these two files?

Gleb

You're welcome, thanks for updating code.

Yes, I agree with you about read-only/read-write routes. However I've not decided yet what to do: externalize read-only routes and make it possible to load external routes in JSON Server, or mutualize code.

Slicing is now available in v0.3.0 :)
I didn't merge because code changed a lot.
Thanks for letting me know. It should work now.

Sorry for taking so long to answer, didn't have access to a computer.
Anyway, thank you for letting me know, it's a bug.

JSON-Server uses node-cors module, I've made a pull request to add PATCH to default supported methods.
I hope it worked for you, if you have any other problems feel free to create an issue or comment.
Updated JSON-Server to 0.3.2. It should have PATCH now in allowed methods.
Thanks!
No, sorry. Not with the current version.
Okie dokie.  I noticed an issue that was closed around getting it to respond to `JSONApi` spec.  How do you do this?

Well, it was just an idea for JSON-Server but never was implemented.

However, if you need to prototype API based on this spec, you can give a try to https://github.com/daliwali/fortune

Thanks for the suggestion!

Hi Kokujin,

Do you have a README for RestClient? I don't know this tool.

Regarding the 500 error, I can give some explanations but not sure if that's what you're asking for.

Anyway, this is because JSONPlaceholder is mostly read-only. It just fakes resources creation and updates.

Here's how it works:

There are 100 posts in JSONPlaceholder.

You can POST to http://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/posts, it will tell you it was created but in fact if you make a GET request to the same URL you'll still have 100 posts.

So when you try to update post 102, it doesn't exist (though I agree there could be a better status code than 500, I'll fix that when I have the time).

If the problem is that there's no post created, I'd suggest that you run JSON Server instead, it's read and write.

Thanks @typicode . I'll probably run my own server although I think the site and fake services great, its so bothersome when one wants to test a client quickly :)

https://github.com/jpillora/jquery.rest

Cool, I appreciate your feedback.
And I'll try to improve the returned status code :)

Thanks for the link.
Thanks!

Hi Raul,

I've been very busy lately with [katon](https://github.com/typicode/katon) and couldn't get back to you before.

Thanks for the pull request. Your idea makes perfectly sense. I took the liberty to make some enhancement to your idea and code. I hope you don't mind.

Since `node-cors` can be configured to return an `Access-Control-Allow-Origin` header that matches the `Origin`, it was actually just a matter of setting two options:
https://github.com/typicode/json-server/commit/c0d43ef437f45288264d5d6ac92d7acdd4a65152

And I've reused your code for `method-override`.

As a side note, it's easier to accept smaller PR, you can do so by creating multiple branch.
Also, your IDE made it a little harder to read by adding `;` which doesn't match the project coding style.

I hope that will help you in your future PRs :)

Hey typicode,

Great to hear my idea got incorporated. Will definitely make smaller PRs in the future. This was actually my first. Also, sorry about the ";" at the end of the lines :]
Thanks, I've added your code to 0.3.11
Thank you :)
